result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric L. Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Delivery of Methamphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order and Amendment to Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases
The Court Orders: It is hereby ordered and adjudged that as to count 1 the defendant is ordered to serve 0 months 120 days of jail time as a condition of probation.
Proposed Order and Amendment to Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases
Petition and Stipulation to Amend Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases
plea questionnaire/waiver of rights

3:40 PM Cases 21CF444, 21CF823, 22CF50 called.  Prosecuting attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eric L. Walker in court.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Eric L. Walker. Defense recites the joint agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
In 21CF444: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 as charged in the Information. 
In 22CF50: Defendant pleads No Contest to Amended Count 1: Delivery of Methamphetamine with the Intent to Deliver on or Near a Park and Count 2 as Charged in the Information. 
Court accepts pleas and finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. Court notes defendant needs to be fingerprinted in 22CF50. 
As to count 1 in 21CF444 and Count 2 in 22CF50: Court orders courts costs and the DNA sample. One bench warrant fee in 21CF444. 
As to count 1 in 22CF50: Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on Probation for 2 and 1/2 years with conditions: 
120 days in Jail with Huber/Electronic Monitoring (if the jail deems it appropriate) all Stayed pending further order of the Court. 
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to pay court costs including the DNA sample and $30 in WCDTF buy funds. 
Defendant has two days credit if revoked from Probation (imputed from 21CF444).
Status conference on June 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

(Cases 21CF444, 21CF823, 22CF50 are called at 10:46 AM) Defendant Eric L. Walker in court.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Eric L. Walker. Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin.  
Defense acknowledges receipt of Informations in 21CF444, 21CF823, waives reading, and enters Not Guilty Pleas. Court receives Not Guilty Pleas in 21CF444, 21CF823 and orders 20 days for motions. Defense requests Status Conference- Court indicates that if no agreement at next hearing a jury trial will be scheduled. 
Status Conference in 21CF444, 21CF823, 22CF50: 06/13/2022 at 3:30 PM.
Arraignment on May 27, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Status conference on April 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

(Cases 21CF444, 21CF823, 22CF50 are called at 3:31 PM- by Zoom) Defendant Eric L. Walker appeared by video, Attorney Katherine Cook for Eric L. Walker appeared in court, Attorney Robert W. Stoiber for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of Information in 22CF50, waives reading and enters Not Guilty pleas on call counts. Court receives Not Guilty pleas in 22CF50 and orders 20 days for motions. 
Court indicates there has not been an arraignment in 21CF444, 21CF823. 
Status Conference: 04/20/2022 at 2:30 PM.
